722945f-b.title: Manhattan: 125th Street (West) - 8th Avenue
722945f-b.text:
Riverside Park: A set of 3 views northwestward across the Hudson
River, showing the U.S. Fleet thereon, from a vantage point near West
124th Street, which would be between Grants Tomb and the Claremont Inn.
October 13, 1912.
Walter L. Bogert.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

715334f-a.title: Manhattan: 125th Street - 8th Avenue
715334f-a.text:
The eastern end of 125th Street at the Harlem River. At the left
is the Randall's Ialand Ferry.
July 31, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

715431f-a.title: Manhattan: 125th Street (West) - 8th Avenue
715431f-a.text:
West 125th Street, at the North (Hudson) River. The photographer
is viewing southeastward to show across Claremont heights the Riverside
Babtist Church and Grants Tomb. The viaduct shown carries automotive
traffic of Riverside Drive across this gap; the low bridge-like
structure, the New York Central Railroad tracks.
June 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

715396f-a.title: Manhattan: 125th Street (West) - 8th Avenue
715396f-a.text:
West 125th Street, south side, at Aighth Ave. (elevated there-
upon), showing under demolition two structures slightly west of that
point. These are No's. 310 and 312 West 125th Street. The elevated
system shown is the Ninth Ave. line, running at this point on Eighth
Ave.
May 1932.
George L. Balgue.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

722948f-a.title: Manhattan: 125th Street (West) - 8th Avenue
722948f-a.text:
Riverside Park: Claremont Inn in all of its glory, located between
General Grants Tomb and West 125th Street.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
